quote: The Work is merely four questions; it's not even a thing. It has no motive, no strings. It's nothing without your answers.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: When I argue with reality, I lose—but only 100% of the time.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: You move totally away from reality when you believe that there is a legitimate reason to suffer.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: An unquestioned mind is the world of suffering.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: No one can hurt me—that's my job.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: If I had a prayer, it would be this: "God spare me from the desire for love, approval, and appreciation. Amen."
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: You either believe what you think or you question it. There's no other choice.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: If I think you're my problem, I'm insane.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: When I am perfectly clear, what is is what I want.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Arguing with reality is like trying to teach a cat to bark—hopeless.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: How do I know that I don't need what I want? I don't have it.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Forgiveness is realizing that what you thought happened, didn't.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Reality is always kinder than the story we tell about it.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: I don't let go of concepts—I question them. Then they let go of me.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Gratitude is what we are without a story.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: When I walk into a room, I know that everyone in it loves me. I just don't expect them to realize it yet.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: For me, reality is God, because it rules.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: You are what exists before all stories. You are what remains when the story is understood.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: I'm a lover of what is, not because I'm a spiritual person, but because it hurts when I argue with reality.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Everyone is a mirror image of yourself—your own thinking coming back at you.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: "I don't know" is my favorite position.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: What is is. You don't get a vote. Haven't you noticed?
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Until you look forward to criticism, your Work's not done.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Thoughts aren't personal. They just appear, like raindrops. Would you argue with a raindrop?
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: There are no new stressful thoughts. They're all recycled.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Stress is an alarm clock that lets you know you've attached to something not true for you.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: We do only three things in life: we sit, we stand, we lie horizontal. The rest is just a story.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: The teacher you need is the person you're living with.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Everyone and everything is doing its job perfectly—no mistake.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Ultimately, I am all I can know.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Until we know that death is equal to life, we live in fear.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: When they attack you and you notice that you love them with all your heart, your Work is done.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Seeking love keeps you from the awareness that you already have it—that you are it.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: We say to others only what we need to hear.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Nothing you believe is true. To know this is freedom.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: If you want to see the love of your life, look in the mirror.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Reality is always the story of a past, and what I love about the past is—it's over.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: We suffer only until we realize that we can't know anything.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: You can only see what you believe—nothing else is possible.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: I could find only three kinds of business in the world—mine, yours, and God's. Whose business are you in?
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: No one has ever been angry at another human being—we're only angry at our story of them.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Just keep coming home to yourself. You are the one you've been waiting for.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: The perfect world is created when the mind is free to see it.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Would you rather be right or free?
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: In my experience, it takes only one person to have a successful relationship, and that's me.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Don't be careful. You could hurt yourself.
source: Your Inner Awakening

quote: Defense is the first act of war.
source: Your Inner Awakening

quote: It's not your job to like me—it's mine.
Don't believe everything you think.
All I have is all I need and all I need is all I have in this moment.
Whatever it takes for you to find your freedom, that's what you've lived.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: We're all looking for love, in our confusion, until we find our way back to the realization that love is what we already are.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: The only way I can be angry at you is when I have thought, said, or done something that is unkind in my own opinion.

As long as you think that the cause of your problem is “out there”—as long as you think that anyone or anything is responsible for your suffering—the situation is hopeless. It means that you are forever in the role of victim, that you're suffering in paradise.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: A thought is harmless unless we believe it. It's not our thoughts, but our attachment to our thoughts, that causes suffering.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: I love what I think, and I'm never tempted to believe it.
source: A Thousand Names for Joy: Living in Harmony with the Way Things Are

quote: There's only one thing harder than accepting this, and that is not accepting it.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: You're just suffering from the belief that there's something missing from your life. In reality, you always have what you need.
source: Question Your Thinking, Change the World: Quotations from Byron Katie

quote: The world is your perception of it. Inside and outside always match—they're reflections of each other. The world is a mirror image of your mind.
source: A Friendly Universe: Sayings to Inspire and Challenge You

quote: If you think he's supposed to be different from what he is, you don't love him. In that moment you love who he's going to be when you're through manipulating him.
source: I Need Your Love – Is That True?

quote: Heaven: "This is wonderful. I could stay here forever." Hell: "This is not quite perfect."
source: I Need Your Love – Is That True?

quote: When you stay out of your family's business, they notice that you have your stuff together and that you're happy, so they start to follow. You've taught them everything they know, and now they begin to learn again. In the presence of someone who doesn't have a problem, they can't hold on to one.
source: Question Your Thinking, Change the World: Quotations from Byron Katie

quote: We all do emotional gymnastics to be seen as wonderful or funny—just to get what we already have. And because we're doing the gymnastics, we don't see that we already have it.
source: I Need Your Love – Is That True?

quote: Inquiry doesn't have a motive. It doesn't teach a philosophy. It's just investigation.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: Life is simple. Everything happens for you, not to you. Everything happens at exactly the right moment, neither too soon nor too late. You don't have to like it—it's just easier if you do.
source: A Thousand Names for Joy: Living in Harmony with the Way Things Are

quote: Self-realization is the sweetest thing. It shows us how we are fully responsible for ourselves, and that is where we find our freedom.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: When you realize that every stressful moment you experience is a gift that points you to your own freedom, life becomes very kind.
source: Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life (2002)

quote: I already please everyone, and I already have everyone's approval, though I don't expect them to realize it yet.
source: A Mind at Home with Itself

quote: The miracle of love comes to you in the presence of the uninterpreted moment. If you are mentally somewhere else, you miss real life.
